channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Federal budget expected to chart a course to meet NATO's 5% spending target
item.description: What will rearming the Canadian military look like? We could get a clearer in Tuesday's federal budget. At least one defence expert says the Liberal government has made a lot of vague promises and there's a need for specifics on programs like the multi-billion dollar submarine replacement plan.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Death at B.C. ostrich farm deemed ‘not suspicious,’ say RCMP
item.description: Chest compressions and other life-saving measures were taken as paramedics rushed to the scene, but despite the best efforts of emergency services, the man passed away.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney's 1st budget aims to balance ‘generational’ spending with cuts
item.description: The question now is whether Carney’s decision to simultaneously run a sizeable deficit while slashing public service jobs will find support among opposition parties.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. premier meets with Indigenous leaders amid Cowichan decision tension
item.description: The province’s appeal of the B.C. Supreme Court’s Cowichan Tribes land title ruling is expected to loom large as Indigenous leaders meet with Premier David Eby and cabinet ministers starting Tuesday in Vancouver.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Chrysler recalling 20,000 Jeep vehicles in Canada due to faulty battery that can catch fire
item.description: Owners of the vehicles — which include Jeep Wranglers with model years between 2020-2025 and Jeep Grand Cherokees with model years from 2022-2026 — are being advised to park the vehicles outside and away from structures until a remedy for the problem is determined.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Shortage of prescription painkillers in Canada expected to last until 2026

item.title: Remains of hostage turned over in Gaza, Israeli military says
item.description: The remains of a hostage in Gaza have been turned over and are now in Israel, the military said Tuesday, in the latest sign of progress under the U.S.-brokered ceasefire.

item.title: Albertan defends recall petition of Angela Pitt, says MLA not representing community
item.description: The Airdrie resident who launched a recall petition of a UCP MLA says Angela Pitt has become less responsive to community concerns.

item.title: Noise, pets and property lines: New Halifax project aims to solve neighbour disputes
item.description: According to statistics from the municipality's 311 program, there have been more than 4,000 calls related to pets and noise complaints so far in 2025.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Less than 50% of Canadians financially optimistic amid U.S. tariffs: survey
item.description: The annual Salvation Army survey found 86% agreed the tariffs were driving up the cost of household staples, and 79% believed they were hurting low-income households the most.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: With hiring of coach Sandy Brondello, Tempo set immediate winning expectation
item.description: Toronto Tempo general manager Monica Wright Rogers had just introduced Sandy Brondello as the team’s inaugural head coach minutes earlier on Tuesday at a press conference in downtown Toronto, and she was already thinking about what that could mean for a roster that is currently blank.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canadians to face ‘no issue' in finding a Christmas tree this year, growers say
item.description: Christmas tree growers say despite concerns of drought, Canadians can expect there will be a tree for everyone but you may need to be open to different varieties.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 3 reports of possible Halloween candy tampering: Regina police
item.description: Regina police say they've now received three different reports of Halloween candy that may have been tampered with.

item.description: Get the best of Vancouver in your inbox, every Tuesday and Thursday. Sign up for our free newsletter.

item.title: Remembering the Quiet Brilliance of Tom Barrett
item.description: His decades of reporting for the Vancouver Sun earned deep respect. Then he became an early pillar of The Tyee.

item.title: Montrealers rally to support hurricane-ravaged Jamaica

item.title: Parts of U.S. airspace may close if government shutdown drags on: official
